description.narrative: Femina targets young people ages 13 - 30 through its media platform. It envisions a gender equal society in which youth are confident and competent change makers who actively participate in the development and wellbeing of Tanzania. Its mission is its expertise in strategic communication and expensive partnership network to reach YP across Tanzania with critical knowledge and platform for conversation.

Femina targets young people ages 13 - 30 through its media platform. It envisions a gender equal society in which youth are confident and competent change makers who actively participate in the development and wellbeing of Tanzania. Its mission is its expertise in strategic communication and expensive partnership network to reach YP across Tanzania with critical knowledge and platform for conversation.

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2016Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The outcomes of Femina Hip’s work, as listed in its results framework, are: Final Outcome: A movement of youth and mentors self-organizes and promotes the Femina Family Agenda Intermediate Outcome: Youth and mentors adopt the promoted behaviours of the Femina Family regarding sexual reproductive health and rights, economic empowerment and citizen engagement. Initial Outcome 1: Youth and mentors have knowledge and awareness about sexual and reproductive health and rights, economic empowerment, and citizen engagement. Initial Outcome 2: Youth and mentors employ both personal and interpersonal life skills. Initial Outcome 3: Youth and mentors have positive attitudes towards the Femina Family behaviours. Initial Outcome 4: Youth and mentors have the perception of their own agency to adopt the Femina Family behaviours. Initial Outcome 5: Youth and mentors perceive that they are supported by people important to them in adopting the Femina Family behaviours.
In 2016, Femina Hip continued to communicate and connect with youth through its multimedia platform as well as through face-to-face activities and active learning in outreach interventions through its Edutainment Media and Outreach Products, namely; Fema Magazine, Fema Radio Show, Website and Social Media, Fema Clubs, Field Trips, Festivals, Sema na Fema SMS platform and Volunteer Programs.
The Fema magazine was distributed quarterly to both secondary schools and active learning partners across Tanzania and includes sections on all three of Femina Hip’s strategic areas: Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights, Economic Empowerment and Citizen Engagement. In 2016 a total of 88 female and 88 male youth were engaged in ‘youth reporting’ and the production of different magazine sections. During the same year, five major outreach trips were made to different regions of the country, in addition to five festivals. Also, over 40,000 SMS were sent and recieved through Femina's SMS platform. The annual report is indicative of Femina Hip's continued drive to reach to vulnarable youth thorugh innivative means in a fast developing landscape.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
